sub_title: ConnectingPeople=MyPassion | Deputy Director @SpeakerAcademy | Non-Profit Entrepreneur | Lawyer | Publisher |
summary:
I am an experienced Deputy Director with a demonstrated history of working in the professional speakers management and consulting industry. Skilled in Business Development, General Management, Trusted Advisor, Legal Counsel, Process Control, Coaching, Privacy Law, Account Management, Innovation Management and People Development. Strong community and social services leader graduated from Leiden University & Erasmus University. 

I devote my free-time as a non-profit entrepreneur for the human rights of others and to promote the principles of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. Founder of not-for-profit organisations in Germany and the Netherlands. Always looking for new opportunities, profit and not-for-profit.

profile_positions.description: Speakers Academy®represents some of the most influential experts and authorities of the world. Together with them we create meaningful and innovative stories for our national and international clients and their audiences. Narratives that must be told and to emphasize our mission statement ‘Bringing Knowledge to the World’.

profile_positions.company: European Center for Not-for-Profit Law Stichting
profile_positions.description:
ECNL’s mission is to create legal and policy environments that enable individuals, movements and organisations to exercise and protect their civic freedoms; and to put into action transformational ideas that address national and global challenges.

Cutting edge expertise in laws affecting civil society | regional perspective which provides innovative approaches to domestic problems | fostering collaboration in order to achieve better and more sustainable results | holistic human rights-based approach

profile_positions.description: The Civil Liberties Union for Europe e.V. is an association of European human rights, civil liberties, watchdog non-governmental organizations (NGOs) in the European Union. The mission is to promote, protect and uphold human rights, civil liberties, the rule of law and democratic values in the European Union.
profile_positions.title: Board Member, Treasurer

profile_positions.description: Since 2014, fourteen independent, national, multi-issue human rights NGOs from the European Union have collaborated with each other on fundamental rights in the European Union in the framework of the European Liberties Platform – an informal, collaborative action and knowledge sharing network with its e-participation website Liberties.eu. In 2016 the partners decided to establish a structured, formalized European cooperation in Berlin Germany.
profile_positions.title: Founding Board - interim Board Member

volunteer_experiences.description: The Study Commission on Criminalization of Speech was founded in 2015 by the Association for Media and Communications Law (VMC) and the Dutch Section of the International Commission of Jurists (NJCM).

The Public Interest Litigation Project (PILP) is a project with which the Dutch Section of the International Commission of Jurists (NJCM) explores the possibility of strategic litigation in the field of human rights in the Netherlands.

volunteer_experiences.role: Project Lead for the Netherlands @Liberties.eu & www.liberties.eu
volunteer_experiences.description: The European Liberties Platform (ELP) is an informal network of European civil liberties watchdog non–governmental organizations (NGOs). The primary focus of the Platform is to support advocacy and mobilization efforts of its partner organizations and to boost the representation of human rights interests at national and European Union (EU) levels. Liberties.eu, the network’s human rights news and e-participation website, is the cornerstone of ELP. Liberties.eu serves as the backbone of ELP’s multilingual communication service with the aim of sharing and raising awareness about human rights issues across Europe.
